solution_line_template: The second neighborhood uses {first_neighborhood_usage} * {multiplier_twice} = <<{first_neighborhood_usage}*{multiplier_twice}={second_neighborhood_usage}>>{second_neighborhood_usage} barrels of water.

The third neighborhood uses {second_neighborhood_usage} + {third_neighborhood_extra} = <<{second_neighborhood_usage}+{third_neighborhood_extra}={third_neighborhood_usage}>>{third_neighborhood_usage} barrels of water.

The first, second, and third neighborhoods together use {first_neighborhood_usage} + {second_neighborhood_usage} + {third_neighborhood_usage} = <<{first_neighborhood_usage}+{second_neighborhood_usage}+{third_neighborhood_usage}={total_usage_first_three_neighborhoods}>>{total_usage_first_three_neighborhoods} barrels of water.

Thus, the fourth neighborhood has {total_capacity} - {total_usage_first_three_neighborhoods} = <<{total_capacity}-{total_usage_first_three_neighborhoods}={fourth_neighborhood_leftover}>>{fourth_neighborhood_leftover} barrels of water left for it to use.
